title: Bindi Irwin to walk down the aisle with a koala at Australia Zoo wedding
text:
Bindi Irwin and Chandler Powell have opted for a not so traditional wedding (Picture: Getty)

Bindi Irwin, daughter of the late crocodile hunter Steve Irwin, has admitted she will walk down the aisle at her wedding with a koala bear.

The 21-year-old is gearing up to marry her childhood sweetheart, Chandler Powell, but they’re not about to have the most traditional of weddings.

Deciding to tie the knot in Australia Zoo, where the pair met and got engaged, Bindi has let on that she’ll walk down the aisle with a koala.

Just what will the bridesmaids think?

Speaking on Good Morning America, Bindi said: ‘I’m not sure how many people have walked down the aisle with a koala, but we may be setting some new trends for weddings from here on out.’

Chandler added: ‘See, I think this wedding is going to be unique because it’s going to be at the zoo with tons of animals.’

Bindi, a wildlife lover, later admitted the ‘big celebration’ is going to include ‘our wildlife’ reflecting on her decision to involve animals in her big day.

They are such an adorable couple

It’s all part of her decision to have her father’s memory live on in ‘special moments’ like these.

Steve Irwin died in 2006 after a fatal encounter with a stingray. Bindi was just eight years old when she lost him.

Bindi lost her dad Steve when she was only eight (Photo: Australia Zoo via Getty Images)

Now, at age 21, she’s marrying the love of her life and she told Us Weekly she wants her dad to be part of the wedding day.

‘I really wanted dad to be a big part of the day, so I’m excited to be able to incorporate him throughout the ceremony and the reception, and I think it’s going to be really special because I feel like his spirit lives on in us,’ Bindi explained.

The couple are so in love its making our hearts melt.

Bindi and Chandler are very excited to get hitched alongside loads of animals

‘The easiest part of wedding planning is just knowing that I get to marry this amazing guy,’ Bindi gushed. ‘Whatever else happens, it doesn’t matter.’

Chandler had to add: ‘How lucky I am, I get the most beautiful girl in the world.

‘I’m marrying into the most wonderful family.’

Stop it guys, we’re welling up.
